Title: Security update for the Linux Kernel

Notes.Text: Security update for the Linux Kernel
Notes.Title: Topic

Notes.Text:
The SUSE Linux Enterprise 12 SP2 kernel was updated to receive the following security fixes:

- CVE-2017-1000251: The native Bluetooth stack in the Linux Kernel was
  vulnerable to a stack overflow while processing L2CAP configuration
  responses, resulting in a potential remote denial-of-service vulnerability
  but no remote code execution due to use of CONFIG_CC_STACKPROTECTOR.
  [bnc#1057389]
Notes.Title: Details

Vulnerabilities.Description: The native Bluetooth stack in the Linux Kernel (BlueZ), starting at the Linux kernel version 2.6.32 and up to and including 4.13.1, are vulnerable to a stack overflow vulnerability in the processing of L2CAP configuration responses resulting in Remote code execution in kernel space.
